author: sky.cactus
content: <@393833580033474560> I think the easiest way to describe the "escalator gas price" is just that `gasPrice` is no longer a fixed value, but instead it is a function of timestamp.  `gasPrice = f(block.timestamp)` essentially.

author: sky.cactus
content:
Specifically, the function being discussed would be something like (example only):
```
gasPrice = min(maxPrice, startPrice + incrementAmount * (block.timestamp - startTime))
```

author: sky.cactus
content: Where `startPrice, startTime, incrementAmount, maxPrice` are all provided by user as part of the transaction.

author: timbeiko
content:
<@!574864862338088960> 
>  if we don't want to bundle EIP 1559 and the escalator
Why is 2718 more or less useful depending on whether 1559 and escalator are bundled?

author: abdel.stark
content: I mean if we had a clear decision now it would be relatively easy to do the implementation (RLP encoding / decoding + hashing / signature of transactions). If we are not sure to bundle them or not it will become more difficult. EIP 1559 brings 2 new fields in the transaction (gasPremium and feeCap). Escalator brings 4 fields (startPrice, maxPrice, startBlock, endBlock). And they don't have the same types nor the same meanings. RLP structure is not "smart", you cannot know what represents a field by a key or something. It is order dependent and you have to know what type to read when you decode. In current Besu implementation and in Geth EIP 1559 PR, the RLP encoding / decoding has been updated to take care of the 2 new fields. But because both EIP -1559 and escalator bring value on their own the combinations for decoding are numerous. Or we would have to have optional fields, or placeholder values or something to discriminate. Having a clear type of transaction makes it much more easy to handle

author: abdel.stark
content: And to be clear 2718 is valuable, independently of any fee market changes EIP. It is just that with those 2 possible EIPs we have 3 transaction types candidates already (EIP1559 alone, escalator alone and EIP1559 + escalator).

author: abdel.stark
content: Hence it would make a lot of sense to have 2718 a requirement for both of them IMO
